014package org.jdbi.v3.core.generic;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType;
017import java.lang.reflect.Type;
018import java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable;
019import java.util.Map;
020import java.util.Optional;
021
022import io.leangen.geantyref.GenericTypeReflector;
023import io.leangen.geantyref.TypeFactory;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.UtilityClassException;
025
026/**
027 * Utilities for working with generic types.
028 */
029@SuppressWarnings("rawtypes")
030public class GenericTypes {
031    private static final TypeVariable<Class<Map>> KEY;
032    private static final TypeVariable<Class<Map>> VALUE;
033
034    static {
035        TypeVariable<Class<Map>>[] mapParams = Map.class.getTypeParameters();
036        KEY = mapParams[0];
037        VALUE = mapParams[1];
038    }
039
040    private GenericTypes() {
041        throw new UtilityClassException();
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Returns the erased class for the given type.
046     *
047     * <p>
048     * Example: if type is <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code>, returns
049     * <code>List.class</code>
050     * </p>
051     * parameter
052     *
053     * @param type the type
054     * @return the erased class
055     */
056    public static Class<?> getErasedType(Type type) {
057        return GenericTypeReflector.erase(type);
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Same as {@link #findGenericParameter(Type, Class, int)} with n = 0.
062     *
063     * @param type the type
064     * @param parameterizedSupertype the parameterized supertype
065     * @return the first parameter type
066     * @see #findGenericParameter(Type, Class, int)
067     */
068    public static Optional<Type> findGenericParameter(Type type, Class<?> parameterizedSupertype) {
069        return findGenericParameter(type, parameterizedSupertype, 0);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * For the given type which extends parameterizedSupertype, returns the
074     * nth generic parameter for the parameterized supertype, if concretely
075     * expressed.
076     *
077     * <p>
078     * Example:
079     * </p>
080     * <ul>
081     * <li>if {@code type} is {@code ArrayList<String>},
082     * {@code parameterizedSupertype} is {@code List.class},
083     * and {@code n} is {@code 0},
084     * returns {@code Optional.of(String.class)}.</li>
085     *
086     * <li>if {@code type} is {@code Map<String, Integer>},
087     * {@code parameterizedSupertype} is {@code Map.class},
088     * and {@code n} is {@code 1},
089     * returns {@code Optional.of(Integer.class)}.</li>
090     *
091     * <li>if {@code type} is {@code ArrayList.class} (raw),
092     * {@code parameterizedSupertype} is {@code List.class},
093     * and {@code n} is {@code 0},
094     * returns {@code Optional.empty()}.</li>
095     * </ul>
096     *
097     * @param type the subtype of parameterizedSupertype
098     * @param parameterizedSupertype the parameterized supertype from which we want the generic parameter
099     * @param n the index in {@code Foo<X, Y, Z, ...>}
100     * @return the parameter on the supertype, if it is concretely defined.
101     * @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if n &gt; the number of type variables the type has
102     */
103    public static Optional<Type> findGenericParameter(Type type, Class<?> parameterizedSupertype, int n) {
104        return Optional.ofNullable(GenericTypeReflector.getTypeParameter(type, parameterizedSupertype.getTypeParameters()[n]));
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Resolves the {@code type} parameter in the context of {@code contextType}. For example, if
109     * {@code type} is {@code List.class.getMethod("get", int.class).getGenericReturnType()}, and
110     * {@code contextType} is {@code List<String>}, this method returns {@code String.class}
111     * @param type the type to be resolved in the scope of <code>contextType</code>
112     * @param contextType the context type in which <code>type</code> is interpreted to resolve the type.
113     * @return the resolved type.
114     */
115    public static Type resolveType(Type type, Type contextType) {
116        return GenericTypeReflector.resolveType(type, contextType);
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Checks whether a given {@link Type} is an Array Type.
121     *
122     * @param type a type
123     * @return whether the given {@link Type} is an Array type.
124     */
125    public static boolean isArray(Type type) {
126        return type instanceof Class<?> && ((Class<?>) type).isArray();
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Returns the element type for an Array Type.
131     *
132     * @param type the array's element type
133     * @return the array Type
134     */
135    public static Type arrayType(Type type) {
136        return TypeFactory.arrayOf(type);
137    }
138
139    /**
140     * Given a subtype of {@code Map<K,V>}, returns the corresponding map entry type {@code Map.Entry<K,V>}.
141     * @param mapType the map subtype
142     * @return the map entry type
143     */
144    public static Type resolveMapEntryType(Type mapType) {
145        Type keyType = resolveType(KEY, mapType);
146        Type valueType = resolveType(VALUE, mapType);
147        return resolveMapEntryType(keyType, valueType);
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Given a key and value type, returns the map entry type {@code Map.Entry<keyType,valueType>}.
152     * @param keyType the key type
153     * @param valueType the value type
154     * @return the map entry type
155     */
156    public static Type resolveMapEntryType(Type keyType, Type valueType) {
157        return TypeFactory.parameterizedClass(Map.Entry.class, keyType, valueType);
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Creates a type of class {@code clazz} with {@code arguments} as type arguments.
162     * <p>
163     * For example: {@code parameterizedClass(Map.class, Integer.class, String.class)}
164     * returns the type {@code Map<Integer, String>}.
165     *
166     * @param clazz     Type class of the type to create
167     * @param arguments Type arguments for the variables of {@code clazz}, or null if these are not
168     *                  known.
169     * @return A {@link ParameterizedType}, or simply {@code clazz} if {@code arguments} is
170     * {@code null} or empty.
171     */
172    public static Type parameterizeClass(Class<?> clazz, Type... arguments) {
173        return TypeFactory.parameterizedClass(clazz, arguments);
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Perform boxing conversion on a {@code Type}, if it is a primitive type.
178     * Otherwise return the input argument.
179     * @param type the type to box
180     * @return the boxed type, or the input type if it is not a primitive
181     */
182    public static Type box(Type type) {
183        return GenericTypeReflector.box(type);
184    }
185}
